intro: Lepidaploa chrysotricha, commonly known as the golden-haired lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its yellow flowers are typically arranged in a cluster, adding to its ornamental value. Lepidaploa chrysotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or woodland areas.
